Description: Fragment of lip, body and handle of Attic black-figured pottery lip-cup; interior glazed black; exterior: lip and handle zone reserved with line between; black on outside of handle; tendril and incised palmette beside handle with added white dot at core of palmette and worn added red on leaves.
Curator's comments: For parallels regarding the palmette, see Robertson 1951, 143-4, no. 1.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0544) (Phase 1)
